Articles.Content:
was fearing this moment...

Hopefully someone can pick this up and work some magic

What? The creator has abandoned the project? D: Please say it ain't so, this really helped me build rockets faster and be more focused in my designs. Really hope that he's not stopped updating it.

No worries guys, I'm just awfully busy lately, heck so busy I didn't even notice 0.22 was released at first.

Will have a look into upgrading the whole thing to 0.22 this weekend.

Edited October 18, 2013 by BlackNecro

No worries guys, I'm just awfully busy lately.

Will have a look into upgrading for 0.22 the whole thing this weekend.

Awesome sauce. By then I might have unlocked enough of my tech tree that I'll need it.

No worries guys, I'm just awfully busy lately, heck so busy I didn't even notice 0.22 was released at first.

Will have a look into upgrading the whole thing to 0.22 this weekend.

thank you for your hard work. cant wait to use it again.

No worries guys, I'm just awfully busy lately, heck so busy I didn't even notice 0.22 was released at first.

Will have a look into upgrading the whole thing to 0.22 this weekend.

Oh yeah! You rock kind sir!

Seriously, coming from someone who suffers from ADD & dyslexia, this mod really really made things way more pleasent to build any rocket. Not to mention being able to quickly check out parts from a new mod or something. This is just a must for KSP!

Squad should contact you to get this integrated in the game.

Many thanks!

Oh, can't wait. I realized, that i can not play without this tiny thing, so am sitting and waiting for update

Many thanks.

I, Desperately, Need, This mod, Updated.

Weekend's end is coming.

Later, I have to go to school.

ahhhhhhhk

This mod is just like a 'weed' for me.

--oops please ignore--

Edited October 20, 2013 by Lucchese
Did not read the entire thread.

For everyone who's lost without the catalog, here's a hotfix to make it work under 0.22.

I'm currently incorperating some bigger bugfixes regarding losing the catalog, as well as implementing some new features.
I am one of those lost souls, you rock sir!
Even with bugfix it is not working properly, it hides new subassembly tab.

Even with bugfix it is not working properly, it hides new subassembly tab.

What do you mean by 'hiding' that the buttons overlap some stock UI functions? If so just move the buttons to be at the bottom of the screen.

What resolution are you playing just out of curiosity?

I'm running it on 0.22 and it's working fine. Sub Assemblies are hidden by default until you have a command/root part in place. I don't like that it works like that, but it's stock functionality.

Even with bugfix it is not working properly, it hides new subassembly tab.

Someone at Squad (I'm looking in your general direction Romfarer) patched in the new subassembly menu in a hell of a hackjob ...

Subassembly tab is visible if no catalog tag is selected, gets hidden when you select any tag, I could have spent a few more hours trying to fix that but I can only continue coding next weekend and I'd rather get something actually usable out to you guys.
Just want to say thank you for the hotfix, as I feel real lost without my catalog

Oh, I see the issue with the SubAssembly. It's a small price to pay to have such a powerful index at the tip of our hands! I get weird fixations when there are too many parts, this helps me focus so much
What's fun and different is to make "project" categories which aren't of a specific mod but destined (or at least considered) for a specific craft or mission.
I humbly request an icon for kspx, interstellar and Near Future parts.
Thanks for the hotfix - I just tried the previous version and when it didn't work, came here to see what was going on. I'll give it a try!

any news for the new version?

mfg

any news for the new version?

mfg

Did you try the hotfix version? Apart for the Sub Assembly shenanigans (IE, you must unselect all filters to see the SA tab), it works fine for me! A few rare select parts don't show up for some of my mod, but it's only a few. (maybe 3-4 total)

Cheers!

Did you try the hotfix version? Apart for the Sub Assembly shenanigans (IE, you must unselect all filters to see the SA tab), it works fine for me! A few rare select parts don't show up for some of my mod, but it's only a few. (maybe 3-4 total)

Cheers!

Yay!

Seriously i was missing my old custom category with easy access to struts, fuel lines and all those parts i always used...
This seriously needs an update. AMAZINGLY useful if you have a ton of mods.
Anyone got this work with KSP 0.22 ? Even with hotfix only thing possible is disable of all mods and my taglist is empty.
